regions.title: Samarkand
regions.desc: Ancient city on the Great Silk Road.
regions.more: Ulugbek (1394–1449) – a great astronomer and mathematician, built Ulugbek Observatory in Samarkand between 1420–1428. Gur-i Amir Mausoleum – burial place of Amir Temur (1336–1405) and his family, built in 1404–1405. Shahi Zinda Complex – ensemble of mausoleums from the 13th–15th centuries. Bibi-Khanym Mosque – constructed in 1404–1405 by Amir Temur's wife. Samarkand is known for science and cultural centers, historical monuments attract tourists.

regions.title: Bukhara
regions.desc: Center of Islamic science and knowledge.
regions.more: Kalon Minaret – built in 1127, a symbol of Bukhara. Ark Fortress – residence of Bukhara emirs, historical monument. Imam Bukhari (810–870) – great scholar of Hadith, born in Bukhara. Numerous madrasahs and scientific institutions contributed to Islamic science development.

regions.title: Khiva
regions.more: Ichan-Qala – historic complex of the 15th–19th centuries, famous for its walls. Al-Khwarizmi (780–850) – founder of algebra, born in Khiva. Abu Rayhan Beruni (973–1050) – expert in astronomy, mathematics and natural sciences, lived in Khiva. Khiva is one of Central Asia's ancient scientific centers.

regions.title: Tashkent
regions.desc: Capital of Uzbekistan, blending history and modernity.
regions.more: Hazrati Imam Complex – center of Islamic science, houses Quran manuscripts. Chorsu Bazaar – ancient trading center, heart of Tashkent. Independence Square – symbol of Uzbekistan's independence. Many museums, theaters, and cultural centers are available for tourists.

regions.title: Shahrisabz
regions.more: Oqsaroy Complex – summer residence of Amir Temur, built between 1380–1390. Shahrisabz was one of the centers of Amir Temur's empire. He had five sons: Jahangir, Umarshaykh, Miranshah, Shahrukh, and Muhammad Sultan.

regions.title: Andijan
regions.desc: Eastern gateway of the Fergana Valley.
regions.more: Zahiruddin Muhammad Babur (1483–1530) – founder of the Baburids, born in Andijan. His memoir 'Baburnama' provides detailed information about his life and era. Andijan is a city with rich historical and cultural heritage.

regions.title: Namangan
regions.desc: Beauty of nature and historical monuments.
regions.more: Namangan is famous for monuments from the Kokand Khanate era. The city contains numerous historical sites and cultural centers.

regions.title: Fergana
regions.more: Fergana is known as a cultural center of the valley. Al-Khwarizmi and Beruni are connected to this region. The city is rich in historical monuments.

regions.title: Navoi
regions.more: Karmana – ancient city, historical center of Navoi region. Nurata Fortress – built by Alexander the Great, 4th century BC. Navoi is named after the great poet and statesman Alisher Navoi (1441–1501).

regions.title: Nukus
regions.desc: Capital of Karakalpakstan, known for Savitsky Art Museum.
regions.more: Savitsky Museum – unique collection of Soviet and avant-garde art. Nukus is known as a center of art and culture.
